p: As regards Peru there is no official data reporting the percentage of vegans or vegetarians in the population. Although it is noticeable that there is a growing population of vegetarian restaurants in the city of Lima and other touristic destinations [ 15], changes towards non-animal based diets tend to occur at faster paces in developed nations [ 16]. Therefore, it is not feasible to expect a rapid shift of vast sectors of the population to environmentally-sustainable diet options.
